text: a couple of weeks ago I posted a
stop-motion video of a packing list of
all the things that I would bring on a
round-the-world trip that would fit into
just a carry-on if you haven't seen the
video yet make sure to check it out
a lot of you since them have been asking
me what my top Travel must-haves are dun
da da da I present to you my top six
Travel must-haves a pashmina can be used
in many different ways ways I probably
haven't even discovered yet you can use
it as a blanket a pillowcase bed cover
skirt shirt or to cover-up in situations
where you shed like middle-eastern
countries or entering churches or in the
Sun I love my headlamp and use it nearly
every day I want to travel it's great
for night walks hikes for reading at
overnight rate or bus journeys before I
discovered a dry lit tallow
I use just a normal towel on my travels
even if I wash myself the night before
moving to another city my towel would be
so wet and smelly since I would have to
shove it in my bag it would take forever
to dry but not a dilute towel it takes
no time to completely dry after each use
it's also soft and light and doesn't
take up nearly as much room as a normal
towel does oh the possibilities one has
with some rope there have been countless
times where I've had rope come in handy
while traveling you can use it for
endless things like using it as a
clothing line or time items to the
outside of your bag
not only is a water filter a great money
saver but it's environmentally friendly
there are many countries around the
world where the tap water is undrinkable
even if the locals drink the water as a
foreigner the water system in your
country is different depending where
you're traveling from and most immune
systems are not able to fight off the
bacteria you can get very sick drinking
the tap water spending the money on a
water filter is well worth it in the end
why would I need a doorstop while
traveling and why on earth it is in the
top five Travel must-haves well from
someone who has been robbed while
sleeping in my hostel room a doorstop is
now my Saviour if you put the doorstop
in front of your door at night it will
make it difficult for someone to get
into your room spending $1 - is well
worth it it was going to protect you and
your valuables so now I want to know
from you what your top six Travel
must-haves are so leave a comment in the
box below because I would love to know
what you guys bring with you on your
adventures if you like what you see
don't forget to subscribe to my channel
because every Thursday I post a new
episode of so you want to travel the
world and I have a lot of new travel
blogs coming your way as well as a
couple of new projects that I'm so
excited to tell you about but you're
gonna have to wait I'll see you next
week
you
